data.text: to interfere so as to weaken or change for the worse —used with with
examples: was charged with tampering with consumer products

data.text: to try foolish or dangerous experiments —used with with
examples: was charged with tampering with consumer products

data.text: to render something harmful or dangerous by altering its structure or composition
examples: was charged with tampering with consumer products
Using a tamper, tamp the coffee down into the filter …

After each truckload of earth fell onto the cobblestones of the Piazza's perimeter, a steamroller flattened it, and five relaxed-looking workmen … patted it smooth with shovels and wooden tampers, and hosed it down.
